isis.stitle: CAB: 5000i AND 9000i CONVENTIONAL - INSTALL - CAB AIR SUSPENSION SYSTEM FOR 9200i DAY CAB MODELS WITH DETROIT DIESEL ENGINES before january 1997

svcproc.title: CAB AIR SUSPENSION SYSTEM FOR 9200 i DAY CAB MODELS WITH DETROIT DIESEL ENGINES before january 1997

svcprocinfo.para: Refer to Figure 110 for Items in parentheses.

The cab air suspension system for the 9200 i day cab models with Detroit Diesel engines before January 1997 contains one air spring (bag) (Item 7), two shock absorbers (Items 8 and 9), and is controlled by the height control valve (Item 10). The air suspension assembly (Figure 110) needs no lubrication and very little maintenance.

The following components - air line (to air spring) (Item 16), hex nipple fitting (Item 14), elbow fitting (Item 15), air spring (bag) (Item 7), height control valve (Item 10), shock absorbers (Items 8 and 9) and lateral control rod (Item 6) - should be checked at the time the truck is being serviced. Immediate corrective action should be taken if a malfunction occurs.

note.para: The height control valve (Item 10), air spring (bag) (Item 7) and shock absorbers (Items 8 and 9) are serviceable and can be replaced individually.

svcprocinfo.para:
Periodically check tightness of all fasteners and air line fitting connections. Refer to the
TORQUE CHART
for (Figure 110) for proper tightening of all fasteners and air line fitting connections.

svcsubproc.title: Install Height Control Valve

note.para: If there is an attempt to disassemble or adjust fittings on the height control valve (Item 10, Figure 110) , it will void the warranty. Contact the air suspension manufacturer for assistance.

svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 110 for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: Position height control valve (Item 10) in place on mounting bracket of crossmember mounting plate (Item 2).

Install two hex head bolts (Item 18) thru height control valve and mounting bracket of crossmember mounting plate (Item 2) and install two hex lock nuts (Item 19). Tighten to 8 to 10 Lbf-ft (11 to 14 N•m).

svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 111 for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: Install height control valve linkage (Item 4) onto threaded ball pivot of height control valve arm (Item 5) by positioning the height control valve linkage socket over threaded ball pivot and pushing linkage socket onto threaded ball pivot until it snaps in place, latch the linkage clip.

Push push to connect connector (Item 7) and air line (supply) (Item 1) into elbow fitting in "SUPPLY" port of height control valve (Item 3). Refer to
TORQUE CHART
for proper tightening of air line fittings.

Push air line (to air spring) (Item 2) into compression nut (Item 8) of elbow fitting in "SUSP" port of height control valve (Item 3). Refer to
TORQUE CHART
for proper tightening of air line fittings.
Build up air pressure and check for air leaks.

Check cab ride height between bottom of cab mounting plate and top of crossmember mounting plate. Cab air suspension ride height is 5 3/16 inches (131.8 mm) (Figure 172) . If adjustment is required, refer to ADJUSTMENTS,
CAB AIR SUSPENSION SYSTEM FOR 9200 i DAY CAB MODELS WITH DETROIT DIESEL ENGINES BEFORE JANUARY 1997
.

svcsubproc.title: Install Cab Air Suspension Shock Absorber
svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 110 for Items in parentheses.

step2.para: Position bottom shaft of shock absorber (Item 9) with shock washer (Item 4) and shock spacer limiter (Item 5) into mounting hole in crossmember mounting plate (Item 2). Ensure that top shock tabs rest above holes in cab mounting plate (Item 1).
Install shock washer (Item 4) and hex flanged lock nut (Item 27) onto bottom shaft of shock absorber (Item 9). Tighten to 10 to 15 Lbf-ft (14 to 20 N•m).
Install two hex flanged head bolts (Item 21) thru shock absorber (Item 9) and cab mounting plate (Item 1) and install two hex flanged lock nuts (Item 24). Tighten to 45 Lbf-ft (61 N•m).
Position shock absorber (Item 8) with bottom shock tabs below holes in crossmember mounting plate (Item 2). Ensure that top shock tabs rest above holes in cab mounting plate (Item 1).

Install two hex flanged head bolts (Item 21) thru shock absorber (Item 8) and cab mounting plate (Item 1) at the top of shock absorber and install two hex flanged lock nuts (Item 24). Tighten to 45 Lbf-ft (61 N•m).

Install two hex flanged head bolts (Item 22) thru crossmember mounting plate (item 2) and shock absorber (Item 8) at the bottom of shock absorber and install two hex flanged lock nuts (Item 24). Tighten to 45 Lbf-ft (61 N•m).

svcsubproc.title: Install Cab Air Suspension Air Spring (Bag)
svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 110 for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: Position air spring (bag) (Item 7) in place between cab mounting plate (Item 1) and crossmember mounting plate (Item 2).
Install machine screw (Item 26) thru crossmember mounting plate (Item 2) into bottom of air spring (bag) (Item 7). Tighten to 40 to 50 Lbf-ft (54 to 68 N•m).
Install hex head bolt (Item 25) thru cab mounting plate (Item 1) into top of air spring (bag) (Item 7). Tighten to 40 to 50 Lbf-ft (54 to 68 N•m).

Install hex nipple fitting (Item 14) into top of air spring (bag) (Item 7). Refer to
TORQUE CHART
for proper tightening of air line fittings.

Install elbow fitting (Item 15) onto hex nipple fitting (Item 14) of air spring (bag) (Item 7). Refer to
TORQUE CHART
for proper tightening of air line fittings.

Push air line (to air spring) (Item 16) into compression nut of elbow fitting (Item 15) at top of air spring (bag) (Item 7). Refer to
TORQUE CHART
for proper tightening of air line fittings.
Build up air pressure and check for air spring operation. Also check for air leaks. Correct as necessary.

Check cab ride height between bottom of cab mounting plate and top of crossmember mounting plate. Cab air suspension ride height is 5 3/16 inches (131.8 mm) (Figure 172) . If adjustment is required, refer to ADJUSTMENTS,
CAB AIR SUSPENSION SYSTEM FOR 9200 i DAY CAB MODELS WITH DETROIT DIESEL ENGINES BEFORE JANUARY 1997
.

svcsubproc.title: Install Lateral Control Rod
svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 110 for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: Install lateral control rod (Item 6) as follows.

step2.para: Position lateral control rod (Item 6) with spacer limiter (Item 3) in mounting bracket of crossmember mounting plate (Item 2) and install hex head bolt (Item 29) from the front thru mounting bracket of crossmember mounting plate and lateral control rod and install hex lock nut (Item 30). Tighten to 40 to 45 Lbf-ft (54 to 61 N•m).

Position lateral control rod (Item 6) with spacer limiter (Item 3) in mounting bracket of cab mounting plate (Item 1) and install hex head bolt (Item 29) from the front thru cab mounting plate and lateral control rod and install hex lock nut (Item 30). Tighten to 40 to 45 Lbf-ft (54 to 61 N•m).
